District Please Select Household Id The sum of adult male and female members must be equal to the total adult members. Adult male members must be equal to the total adult members. Adult female members must be equal to the total adult members. The sum of adolescent boys and girls must be equal to the total adolescents. Adolescent boys must be equal to the total adolescents. Adolescent girls must be equal to the total adolescents. The sum of male and female children must be equal to the total number of children. Male children must be equal to the total number of children members. Female children must be equal to the total number of children members. The sum of male and female earning members must be equal to the total number of earning members. Male earning members must be equal to the total number of earning members. Female earning members must be equal to the total number of earning members.

The minimum age of the applicant must be 18 years and the maximum age limit is set to 45 years. 1.2. Applicant education 2.1. Self-employment / business experience 2.2. Years of experience in Self-employment / business 2.3. Stage of Self-employment / enterprise idea 2.4. Expected Size/Investment of self-employment / business planned/or yet to be planned 2.5. Willingness to invest margin money in business 2.6. Awareness on relevant markets and supply chain actors for the proposed self-employment / business 3.1. If you are asked to invest INR 50,000 in a new business idea from your savings, how will you evaluate the risk? 3.2. If you are given three options of Income Generation Activity depending upon time to be invested per day, which one will you prefer? 3.3. If you are given three options of Income Generation Activity depending upon staff required to be managed which one, will you prefer?,\nRun a business 3.4. Women cannot become good entrepreneurs as they are burdened with domestic work in their households” How much do you agree with this statement?,\nRun a business 3.5. “An entrepreneur requires only financial resources to become an entrepreneur.” How much do you agree with this statement? 3.6. Willingness to invest time for capacity building trainings to be organized by CARE India for potential entrepreneurs? 201. I feel anxious/less confident while taking a decision> 202. I consult others before taking a decision 203. I can take my own decision 204. I often feel helpless and want someone else to solve my problems. 205. I don’t run away from problems, rather think of possible solutions to address it 206. I can stay calm in stressful situation and deal with it patiently (eg. Loss of job, death of a dear one; loss of property and livelihood due to disaster etc.) 207. I get emotional about things easily 208. I can think and analyse things before coming to a conclusion 209. With the support of my family members/spouse I can manage time between my job and household chores 210. I take out some time from my daily schedule for leisure/ relaxation/rejuvenation 211. I run away from places of conflicts (both at work and domestic space) 212. Wherever required, I can resolve a conflict amicably 213. I can think/come up with new ways of doing things (at personal and professional level) 214. When things go wrong, I get discouraged/upset and feel like giving up. 215. Whatever the circumstances may be, I always try to get the job done (complete the work). 216. I can take a stand for myself in situations unfavourable/against me 217. I can make people listen/respond to me. 218. I am proud of my talents/skills 219. I feel sad for others at their loss 220. I am satisfied with the training I received on Life skill from CARE India
